definition: to do what one is told/obedient
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

pinyin: ting1 hua4 ting1 sheng1 , luo2 gu3 ting1 yin1

sentences.english: A rebellious congress overrode the president's veto.
sentences.chinese: 不听话的国会推翻了总统的否决。

sentences.english: Mrs Durbeyfield was only too delighted at this tractability.
sentences.chinese: 看见苔丝这样听话，德北菲尔德太太不由得心中大喜。

sentences.english: He was lazy, disobedient, and wild.
sentences.chinese: 他好吃懒做，是个不听话的十足野孩子。

sentences.english: At nine years old, I was the perfect student.
sentences.chinese: 九岁的我是模范学生，好学，听话，负责任。

sentences.english: He was obedient and faithful, always wishing to honour and protect his master.
sentences.chinese: 他还很忠诚听话，总希望保护老师，光耀师门。

sentences.english: He promised that the horse was well behaved.
sentences.chinese: 他保证这匹马会很听话的。

sentences.english: The headmaster caned the boys for disobedience.
sentences.chinese: 校长用藤条责打不听话的男学生。

sentences.english: Now, come on, Loll. You're a big boy now.
sentences.chinese: 别这样，听话，劳尔，你现在都是一个大男孩了。

sentences.english: In the old society the teacher often cracked the disobedient pupil's fingers with his ruler.
sentences.chinese: 旧社会老师经常用戒尺打不听话的学生的手指头。

sentences.english: Do as mother says. If you are insubordinate father will probably hear of it.
sentences.chinese: 按照妈妈说的做，如果不听话的话就告诉爸爸。

sentences.english: I was six years old and my sister, Sally Kay, was a submissive three.
sentences.chinese: 那一年我6岁，听话的妹妹萨利凯只有3岁。

sentences.english: Can secure indocile clear sea with a bit wax.
sentences.chinese: 可以用一点发蜡来固定不听话的浏海。

sentences.english: Lunchtime and the “good kids” made a beeline for it.
sentences.chinese: 午饭时分，“听话的孩子”直奔这里。

sentences.english: When you have been amazing things curb, you would not dare not obedient.
sentences.chinese: 当你被神奇的东西镇住时，你是不敢不听话的。

sentences.english: Her brother always teased her before he obeyed and I stood by the railings looking at her.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟总喜欢在听话之前戏弄她一番。

sentences.english: Children are not so well-behaved nowadays as they used to be.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们现在没有过去那样听话了。

definition: (of a child) well-behaved/obediently/(term of endearment for a child) darling/sweetie
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
